page.description: If you have a class type, such as SQL::Arguments, and you say dim args as new SQL::Arguments = new SQL::Arguments, then whatever was there to begin with will be overwritten with the brand new definition of SQL::Arguments.
page.syntax: dim args as new class1 = new class2

argument.name: class1
argument.description: The class type to be overwritten

argument.name: class1
argument.description: The new class type being assigned.
